intro: Hieraciodes fallax, commonly known as the variable hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and leaf structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, with a rough texture and a slightly lobed appearance. Hieraciodes fallax is known for its variability in flower color and leaf shape, making it a distinctive species within its genus.
